title: Andyhawk777
author: Andyhawk777
content: New poster here, just wanted to share the winnings from my session today on a new casino as I'd like to leave a good review. I deposited $100 to start with and proceeded to hit a few 20x multipliers on $5 bets getting me up to around $370. I then waited for red streaks of 4 or more and then martingaled it all the way up to $2800 then went down to $2519 when I cashed out.Deposit and withdrawal was instant, the game is very fun it's like dice. Overall 9/10 would recommend - only thing is they don't offer any deposit bonus it would be nice to have some sort of offer in the future!https://ibb.co/560fppyhttps://ibb.co/bB9wq7P

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: So you deposited to an unknown site, you made some bets and won, and finally decided to make a brand new account here on bitcointalk and tell us to try out a site we haven't heard of? If you are a part of that site, why not create an announcement thread? Give yourself a proper introduction instead of hoping 1 newbie vouch works miracles for you?

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.created_time: April 16, 2023, 06:52:03 PMLast edit: December 16, 2023, 06:34:30 PM by Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: STAY AWAY FROM THIS SITE, IT'S LIKELY A SCAM SITE OWNED BY THE OP. Yes, this casino site is just two weeks old, and the site looks completely like something done in a hurry, that is an indication of a scam site, this site is likely owned by op, else, he or she wouldn't come up with such a ridiculous rating for a site that is just two weeks old, and also note that op is a newbie, and this is his or her first post/thread  on this forum, there is a chance he's going about posting this same thread on different forums to try to get unsuspecting victims to deposit into his scam casino  - please stay far away..

comments.author: Andyhawk777
comments.body: Quote from: yahoo62278 on April 16, 2023, 06:47:15 PMSo you deposited to an unknown site, you made some bets and won, and finally decided to make a brand new account here on bitcointalk and tell us to try out a site we haven't heard of? If you are a part of that site, why not create an announcement thread? Give yourself a proper introduction instead of hoping 1 newbie vouch works miracles for you?Lol, I was told to review their site on this forum at the footer of my withdrawal email. Out of respect for them paying me out with no hassle, and not using KYC as an excuse for freezing withdrawals like other sites on here; I will happily review this casino and support them & If I face issues I will leave a complaint the same way I left this review.

There is no minimum deposit and it is provably fair. Before you call anything a scam be sure of it.

comments.author: Mate2237
comments.body: Op we thank God you successfully deposited and had a smooth deposit from the casino website. But you have dropped the website link here for us to easily accessible. The image link you provided, I didn't see any reasonable object there. And also the way you presented the presentation, You are advertising your personal casino site that looks scam. Quote from: Andyhawk777 on April 16, 2023, 07:17:29 PMIf they're a scam they aren't very good they just lost $2419. There is no minimum deposit and it is provably fair. Before you call anything a scam be sure of it. If it is not a the way you are claiming then, make a comprehensive Review on the casino and if you are not the owner of the company then use gamblingbro to make the Review and launch your review here for us to see.

Out of respect for them paying me out with no hassle, and not using KYC as an excuse for freezing withdrawals like other sites on here; I will happily review this casino and support them & If I face issues I will leave a complaint the same way I left this review.It would have been all fine and good if you mentioned at the beginning of your post that you were participating in a review campaign and put more effort into signaling both the pros and cons of that casino. All this just makes people here to be more skeptic of a service, specially if a newbie account comes around here talking wonders of an unknown platform and even mentioning non-KYC.It is a series of red flags for anyone with a little bit of common sense.  Only because they pay for advertisement, does not mean they are legit.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Op, now that you have shared your testimony what are you expecting forum members to do? Should they now go to the mentioned casino and start using it for gambling? The whole thing looks shady to me.If a casino as big as coinplay could cheat its customers I wonder what an unknown casino like the one you mentioned would do. I'm very sure that the Op is part of the casino's team and hoping he would be able to attract those that would end up being scammed into the casino by just creating a praise casino.If you feel that the casino is great as you claimed then let them come to the forum so that members can test-run it and see if there are any green flags so that they can alert others of them. I would advise that everyone stay away from the casino Op mentioned, the fact that he just came out of the blue and started raining praises is a red flag on its own.

comments.author: BitcoinPanther
comments.body: @OP if you are the owner of the site then why not just create an announcement thread on this forum as what yahoo2278 stated.  I know being newly created casino platform (2 weeks according to the earlier reply) you will have definitely a low trust score. Quote from: Andyhawk777 on April 16, 2023, 07:17:29 PMIf they're a scam they aren't very good they just lost $2419. There is no minimum deposit and it is provably fair. Before you call anything a scam be sure of it.If they are scam, their action could be a bait to gather more people into the site so that they can get more money before they initiate their scam.  This is like giving some meat to get the bone.Quote from: Andyhawk777 on April 16, 2023, 07:09:42 PMLol, I was told to review their site on this forum at the footer of my withdrawal email. Out of respect for them paying me out with no hassle, and not using KYC as an excuse for freezing withdrawals like other sites on here; I will happily review this casino and support them & If I face issues I will leave a complaint the same way I left this review.I do no think that is a good move from the casino, before anything else, they should create a service announcement thread on the forum before asking anyone to make a review of their site.  Your statement makes us think that you are part of the casino platform and you are trying to bait gamblers with your post of winnings and easy withdrawal.

comments.author: bittraffic
comments.body: New casinos ask thier players to review them and specifically point bitcointalk, that is like asking you to spam this forum in order for them to gain users here. Of course, this is a plan. Every new crypto casino today has plans to promote but new doesn't always mean real and the possibility of scams is out of the question. That is very convenient to them while not really introducing it thru ANN thread. The community will not have the means to give them a trust rating if they don't have an account here.

Put $0.50 in and see how it goes if your so inclined. Regardless of your opinion, I'm going to deposit again tomorrow, if you don't know the site then do your due diligence before playing, but don't claim that I or their site is a scam unless you have evidence.The only reply that makes sense to me is from @BitcoinPanther, till they gain more reputation I will be cautious to deposit any large amounts, that's why I only deposit $100 at the start to play. Now that they paid I'm more confident. If anything goes wrong I will edit this post, I will keep playing till then.https://ibb.co/xC5CrCf

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: Quote from: Andyhawk777 on April 16, 2023, 07:17:29 PMIf they're a scam they aren't very good they just lost $2419. There is no minimum deposit and it is provably fair. Before you call anything a scam be sure of it.Well, the fact that the site is just two weeks old and you are a brand new user on this forum raises some red flags. It's not uncommon for scammers to create fake sites, lure people in with promises of big payouts, and disappear with the money. I take it you are unable to attach some verifiable proof, like a blockchain transaction, instead of just screenshots that can be easily faked?

comments.author: Andyhawk777
comments.body: Quote from: coin-investor on April 16, 2023, 09:05:54 PMQuote from: Andyhawk777 on April 16, 2023, 07:34:11 PMI see, strikebits themself told me to use bitcointalk to post my review for a bonus, so I thought this was the right platform. I will upload an extended review to gamblingbro. Also, I didn't include the link in my post ?Why don't they first launch their announcement here and then drop you're testimonial and review, the answer is they are afraid to be under scrutinize because of the bad reviews coming from the other review site and is likely to get much worse reviews here because of the kind of script they are using you cannot access the game or explanation about what's on it.No one is being paranoid here this is just the common tactic used by scam casinos and if your casino is doing this, we perceive it that way.https://i.imgur.com/qLhDiEf.pngI have not found any bad reviews about the site? If you have any please link them here I'd like to see.Also I did my due diligence regarding the game's script before playing, it says this about it in their tos: "We concatenate the client seed, server seed, and nonce together and hash them using the SHA-256 algorithm to create a unique hash. We then take the first 8 characters of the hash (which represents 32 bits of data) and convert it to an integer. We use modulo arithmetic to get a value between 0 and 2400, and then divide by 100 to get a decimal value between 0 and 24. We can then use this value to determine the outcome of the game."I don't really know what that means, but if someone can educate me on if that sounds accurate I would be greatful to know before I deposit again.
